etymology.description: Pictogram: basin with water; later added vertical ‘riverbank’ strokes and the water component 氵.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a deep, enclosed pool of water, evoking a sunken basin. Later additions emphasize the banks and clarify the aquatic meaning, reinforcing the sense of depth and an abyss.
etymology.simplification: Traditional 淵 was streamlined by removing/merging intricate interior strokes into a simpler right-side form while retaining the water radical, reducing stroke count for easier writing.

examples.chinese: 他站在深渊边缘(他站在深淵邊緣)。
examples.english: He stood at the edge of the abyss.

examples.chinese: 这个问题牵涉很深，像一座思想的深渊(這個問題牽涉很深，像一座思想的深淵)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège wèntí qiānshè hěn shēn, xiàng yī zuò sīxiǎng de shēnyuān.
examples.english: This problem runs very deep, like an abyss of thought.
